content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Advanced SIEM Use Cases, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Advanced SIEM Use Cases

content.text: This lesson covers: Log correlation, Use case development, Alert tuning, Threat detection. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Log correlation enables attackers (or defenders) to building correlation rules and dashboards.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Advanced SIEM Use Cases daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What is SIEM correlation?
options: Combining multiple events to detect complex attacks
post_assessment.explanation: Correlation combines events from multiple sources to detect attack patterns that single events wouldn't reveal.

post_assessment.question: What makes a good SIEM use case?
options: Detects real threats with low false positives
post_assessment.explanation: Good use cases balance threat coverage with manageable false positive rates.
